snippet: Bee colonies have been dying in increasing numbers, and the latest suspect is a pesticide used to protect common agricultural seeds.
abstract: Editorial calls attention to fact that bee colonies have been dying in increasing numbers and that 2012 was especially bad; calls on Environmental Protection Agency to conduct immediate analysis of class of pesticides known as neonicotinoids, which have been demonstrated to damage bees' brain function.
lead_paragraph: Bee colonies have been dying in increasing numbers, and the latest suspect is a pesticide used to protect common agricultural seeds.

headline.seo: Calamity for Our Most Beneficent Insect
headline.main: Calamity for Our Most Beneficent Insect
headline.print_headline: Calamity for Our Most Beneficent Insect
